artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Artist: Kobayashi Toshimitsu; Author: Ōkubo Shunrei; Publisher: Yamanaka Kitarō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 336.12; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 282.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: sea scene with many small brown boats in foreground, with figures (some seated, some standing) wearing bright solid colored garments and black conical hats; large black ship at left; mountains in background on low horizon line; red border with green vines around image
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Chronical of the Imperial Restoration (Kōkoku isshin kenbunshi 皇国一新見聞誌)
signed: 大蘇芳年 {Taiso Yoshitoshi} | 輔筆年参 {hohitsu Toshimitsu}
title: No. 1, Arrival of American Ships at Uraga
